text: Alf Lüdtke (18 October 1943 – 29 January 2019) (also Alf Luedtke) was a German historian. He was born in Dresden. He was a leading German representative of the history of everyday life (Alltagsgeschichte in German). Lüdtke was the founder and editor of the journal Sozialwissenschaftliche Informationen, as well as co-founder and co-editor of the journals Werkstatt Geschichte and Historische Anthropologie. Kultur – Gesellschaft – Alltag. Lüdtke died on 29 January 2019 in Dresden from a stroke, aged 75.Trauer um Prof. Dr. Alf Lüdtke ==References== ==Other websites== * Alf Lüdtke on the website of the University of Erfurt (with complete list of publications) Category:1943 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:German educators Category:German historians Category:People from Dresden
